author: Marketing Communications: Web | University of Notre Dame
title: University of Notre Dame makes historic investment in affordability and access for international students | News | International Student and Scholar Affairs | University of Notre Dame
text:
University of Notre Dame makes historic investment in affordability and access for international students
The University of Notre Dame announced a historic expansion to its affordability and accessibility initiatives, becoming the first highly selective faith-based university in the United States to be need-blind for all students, both domestic and international. Notre Dame is now one of only nine highly selective universities in the United States that have a need-blind admissions policy for all students.
For
[international students](https://financialaid.nd.edu/apply-or-renew/international-students/), this means that the University of Notre Dame will provide financial aid in the form of scholarships to meet 100% of a family's demonstrated financial need*.
*Demonstrated financial need is what a family needs in scholarships or grants to meet the Cost of Attendance and comfortably afford to send their child to the Univeristy of Notre Dame. The demonstrated financial need figure is determined by a family's individual financial circumstances. There are both need-based scholarships and merit-based scholarships available for international students to meet a family's demonstrated financial need. The net price—the amount a family actually pays for one year of university—is calculated by subtracting the total amount of scholarships from the Cost of Attendance. Please visit
[financialaid.nd.edu](https://financialaid.nd.edu) where you can find specific information for prospective international students, as well as a [financial aid terms dictionary](https://financialaid.nd.edu/costs-and-affordability/financial-aid-dictionary/).
Notre Dame’s 18th President,
[Rev. Robert A. Dowd, C.S.C.](https://president.nd.edu/about/), made this announcement during his address at his Inauguration Ceremony on Friday, September 13, 2024. In charting a course for Notre Dame, Father Dowd articulated the University’s unwavering commitment as the world’s leading Catholic research university to ensuring that a Notre Dame education should be affordable for all students.
Representing a historic financial aid commitment,
[Pathways to Notre Dame](https://admissions.nd.edu/aid-affordability/) includes two significant initiatives: a new no-loan policy for undergraduate students, ensuring middle- and low-income families who are admitted will be able to afford attendance, and an expansion of its need-blind policy — an institutional commitment to not consider a student’s financial circumstances when deciding whether to admit them — to include both domestic and international students.
“We want an undergraduate student body that reflects the rich diversity of the Catholic community in and beyond the United States, which requires a Notre Dame education be both accessible and affordable,” Father Dowd said. “We are profoundly grateful for the extraordinary generosity of those benefactors who have made it possible for us to take this important next step in ensuring that every student who is admitted will have the opportunity to attend the University, no matter their financial circumstances or where in the world they call home.”
“The University has throughout its history been committed to welcoming students from all walks of life and providing them with a distinctive Notre Dame education, one that seeks to educate the mind as well as the heart,” John B. Veihmeyer, chair of the Board of Trustees, said. “Today’s announcement will ensure that the University is able to carry forward this proud tradition in important new ways, welcoming students from across the U.S. and around the globe and creating an even more vibrant learning environment for all.”
Effective immediately, Notre Dame will not consider the financial situation of students or their families, domestic or international, in the application for admission. Student loans will not be a component of the financial aid offer for full-time first-year and transfer undergraduate students entering fall 2025; instead, that need will be met with gift aid. While Notre Dame will not include loans in financial aid packages, families may still elect to take out federal student or private loans.
“Pathways to Notre Dame reflects Notre Dame’s commitment to attracting students who seek academic excellence and have the desire, curiosity and zeal that is at the heart of a Notre Dame education,” Vice President for Undergraduate Enrollment
[Micki Kidder](https://www.nd.edu/about/leadership/council/micki-kidder/) said. “These initiatives will remove barriers for talented and faith-filled students to flourish here, regardless of their families’ financial circumstances.”
“At Notre Dame, we are called to be seekers of truth, sustainers of hope and builders of bridges,” Father Dowd said. “By extending and expanding the opportunities we are able to offer students, we seek to prepare the next generation of capable, compassionate, ethical leaders for our communities, our nation and the world.”
Originally published by Notre Dame News at
[news.nd.edu](https://news.nd.edu/news/university-of-notre-dame-makes-historic-investment-in-affordability-and-access/) on September 13, 2024. Contact: Sue Ryan, executive director of media relations, 574-631-7916, [sue.ryan@nd.edu](mailto:sue.ryan@nd.edu)
Edits were created by Notre Dame Global on Decemer 5, 2024, to provide further detail and context for international applicants.

author: Redacción El Comercio Perú
title: Ministro del Interior: "Todos los niveles de inteligencia" trabajan para capturar a Vladimir Cerrón | Últimas | POLITICA | EL COMERCIO PERÚ
text: [1](/luces/musica/pedro-suarez-vertiz-fallecio-a-los-54-anos-tras-una-larga-enfermedad-farandula-ultimas-noticia/) El ministro del Interior, [Víctor Torres Falcón](https://elcomercio.pe/noticias/victor-torres-falcon/?ref=ecr#google_vignette/), aseguró que todos los niveles de Inteligencia están trabajando para dar con el paradero de [Vladimir Cerrón](https://elcomercio.pe/noticias/vladimir-cerron/?ref=ecr#google_vignette/), quien se encuentra prófugo desde octubre del 2023 para no cumplir con la condena de prisión efectiva ordenada en su contra. En declaraciones a la prensa, el ministro descartó que las autoridades no puedan ubicar al exgobernador de Junín sentenciado por corrupción durante su gestión. “Todos los niveles de Inteligencia del país, llámase DINI, Digemin, Dirin, están trabajando al respecto, en armonía y en conjunto con la Policía Nacional del Perú”, aseguró. Vladimir Cerrón se encuentra en la clandestinidad desde octubre del 2023, cuando el Poder Judicial dictó una orden de prisión efectiva en su contra por el caso Aeródromo Wanka, además de enfrentar un pedido de prisión preventiva en su contra por otro proceso en investigación por supuesto lavado de activos. “La policía está cerca y garantizamos que todo este tema se va a corregir, se va a solucionar y se va a capturar”, insistió el ministro del Interior. En la víspera, y ante la información sobre un supuesto intento de Cerrón Rojas de buscar asilo en una embajada como la de Bolivia o Cuba, el jefe de la Dirección de Investigación Criminal (Dirincri) de la Policía, general Óscar Arriola, aseguró que están trabajando todos los días para dar con el prófugo. “Nosotros somos los buenos policías que estamos atrás de Cerrón y de todas las personas que tienen deudas con la justicia y garantizamos que va a caer, aquí o en cualquier lugar del mundo”, aseguró este miércoles a RPP.

author: @foxweather
title: Airborne assets helping to assess impact of flooding in Texas | Latest Weather Clips | FOX Weather
text: NASA says it is sharing data it is collecting with first responders in Texas, to help with the recovery process from the deadly flooding.

author: Новостник
title: Stampa tedesca: droni sconosciuti avvistati su infrastrutture critiche nel nord della Germania
text: Stampa tedesca: droni sconosciuti avvistati su infrastrutture critiche nel nord della Germania [droni](https://it.topwar.ru/armament/drones/)di origine sconosciuta sono stati avvistati su infrastrutture critiche nel nord della Germania. La procura tedesca ha avviato un'indagine sulle attività illegali di ignoti. Lo riporta la stampa tedesca. Secondo la procura, droni sconosciuti vengono utilizzati per la ricognizione delle infrastrutture critiche al fine di effettuarne il sabotaggio. Gli aerei sono stati avvistati sopra aree industriali, tra cui una centrale nucleare, impianti chimici e un terminale GNL nello stato federale dello Schleswig-Holstein, nel nord della Germania. Inoltre, i droni sopra di loro sono stati avvistati più volte, la prima volta l’8 agosto e l’ultima volta la notte del 22. È possibile che siano comparsi prima, ma semplicemente non sono stati notati. [fuco](https://it.topwar.ru/armament/drones/)sulle infrastrutture critiche nello Schleswig-Holstein, - ha detto la procura in un comunicato. La stampa tedesca propone diverse versioni sull’identità dei droni; vince con ampio margine quella che afferma che si tratta di russi, e dell’Orlan-10 militare, che ha una gittata compresa tra 500 e 600 km e può volare a 100 metri. velocità superiori a XNUMX km orari. Chi ne dubiterebbe. Tuttavia, questa versione non è stata confermata ufficialmente. Allo stesso tempo, si nota che la comparsa di UAV sconosciuti sulla Germania non è la prima: sono stati più volte notati sui campi di addestramento militare dove viene addestrato il personale militare ucraino. Finora i tedeschi non sono riusciti a stabilire la proprietà dei droni.

author: Bri Amaranthus
title: Why Oregon Football Lost Four-Star Recruit Josiah Sharma To Texas Longhorns
text:
The Oregon Ducks 2025 recruiting class took a hit as four-star defensive lineman Josiah Sharma flipped to the Texas Longhorns. Bri Amaranthus | 3 Hours Ago

author: Gustavo Rangel
title: AN sancionó Ley de Fiscalización y Regulación de las ONG
text:
Los diputados y diputadas a la Asamblea Nacional sancionaron este jueves el proyecto de Ley de Fiscalización, Regularización, Actuación y Financiamiento de las Organizaciones No Gubernamentales y Organizaciones Sociales Sin Fines de Lucro.
El referido instrumento legal fue aprobado por unanimidad. Luego de este paso, según dicta la norma, la referida Ley debe ser remitida al Ejecutivo para su promulgación.
Es importante destacar que en el articulado de esta Ley se establece que el ministerio de Interior, Justicia y Paz deberá constituir y mantener un registro nacional de ONG y Organizaciones Sociales sin fines de lucro, el cual deberá contener una sistematización y actualización de informaciones relativas a la constitución, financiamiento, funcionamiento y modificación de las mismas.
Asimismo, establece que las ONG y Organizaciones Sociales sin fines de lucro deberán obtener el registro fiscal en cumplimiento de la legislación tributaria.
Esta Ley tiene por propósito revisar y hacer seguimiento a las ONG que reciben financiamiento, las cuales en muchos casos han sido utilizadas como instrumentos para atacar al pueblo y sufragar acciones en contra de nuestro país.
En sus artículos quedan claramente establecidas las responsabilidades y deberes de las Organizaciones No Gubernamentales y Afines, así como la normativa para su funcionamiento y financiamiento.

author: SUMMIT-TRIBUNE STAFF
title: New Hanson Nature Center will have four open houses, grand opening
text: At the end of January, the Winnebago County Conservation Board moved its offices into the Hanson Nature Center and is now ready to showcase the new facility. The WCCB has scheduled a series of four open Houses during which people will be able to tour the new building. Those events are scheduled for 1-4 p.m. on Feb. 23, March 1, March 8, and March 16. Winnebago County Naturalist Lisa Ralls said the building still needs furnishings and exhibits, but everyone is encouraged to attend one of the open houses. In addition to touring the new facility, the will be able to enjoy some refreshments and see what the center will soon be able to offer. In the spring, once the center is furnished and has some displays, the WCCB plans to schedule a grand opening. After that, they’ll establish regular hours when the center will be open to the public. People are also reading… Ralls said the WCCB wishes to, once again, thank everyone who has contributed to the construction of the Hanson Nature Center. As a result of the move, the Winnebago County Conservation Board’s new address is the Hanson Nature Center, 41600 Highway 69, Leland, IA, 50453. The new phone number is 641-567-3390.
